revised_title: Ionisation Potentials of Mercury, Cadmium, and Zinc: Single and Many-Lined Spectra
tldr: The authors investigate the ionisation potentials of mercury, cadmium, and zinc, and find that single-line spectra can be obtained with a specific range of arcing voltages. They also determine the minimum arcing potential differences required to produce many-lined spectra for each element. The results suggest that the conditions for obtaining these two types of spectra are sharply differentiated.
